name: ERC20 Permit
description: Extension containing the permit method, which can be used to change an account's ERC20 allowance by presenting a message signed by the account.

eventDecorators.name: Token transfer
eventDecorators.description: Indicates that ERC20 transfer has occurred.

parameterDecorators.name: Sender address
parameterDecorators.description: Address from which the ERC20 token was sent.

parameterDecorators.name: Recipient address
parameterDecorators.description: Address to which the ERC20 token was sent.

parameterDecorators.name: Token amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount of ERC20 token that was sent.

functionDecorators.name: Permit
functionDecorators.description: Grants the given spender rights to manage given amount of owner's tokens. Owner must construct his intent off-chain and call this function while providing the message signature (see EIP-2612).

parameterDecorators.name: Owner
parameterDecorators.description: Account of the owner who constructed and signed the allowance.

parameterDecorators.name: Spender
parameterDecorators.description: Spender account defined in the signed message.

parameterDecorators.name: Amount
parameterDecorators.description: Amount of tokens to approve, defined in the signed message.

parameterDecorators.name: Deadline
parameterDecorators.description: Deadline, defined in the signed message, after which the signed message becomes invalid and cannot be processed anymore by calling this function.

functionDecorators.name: Get next valid nonce
functionDecorators.description: Returns the next valid nonce which must be used by the account when constructing and signing delegateBySig() or permit() functions.

parameterDecorators.name: Account
parameterDecorators.description: Account for which the next valid nonce is queried.

returnDecorators.name: Nonce
returnDecorators.description: Next valid nonce to be used for signing off-chain transactions: see permit() and delegateBySig() functions.

functionDecorators.name: Get domain separator
functionDecorators.description: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for permit, as defined by EIP712.

returnDecorators.name: Domain separator
returnDecorators.description: Domain separator is defined according to the EIP712. The domain separator should be unique to the contract and chain to prevent replay attacks from other domains.
